main_definition: To exchange goods or services for money.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To transfer ownership of an item in return for payment.
meanings_and_examples.example: I sold my old laptop to a friend yesterday.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To convince someone to purchase something by promoting its benefits or features.
meanings_and_examples.example: The salesperson tried to sell the customer on the idea of buying an expensive car insurance policy.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To distribute products in large quantities, often through a retail outlet or online platform.
meanings_and_examples.example: She sold her homemade cookies at the local farmer's market.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To give up control of something for money or other valuable consideration.
meanings_and_examples.example: He had to sell his shares in the company due to financial difficulties.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To use cunning, persuasion, or deception to obtain an advantage or benefit.
meanings_and_examples.example: The politician was accused of selling votes by promising favors and benefits.
